cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles north of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-to-north-east, forecast to parallel the west coast of Florida, then cross Apalachee Bay and move inland across Georgia toward the southeastern Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Apalachee Bay / Florida Big Bend coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch posted Englewood FL northward to Suwannee River FL (west coast of Florida)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning in effect for Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf coast of Florida, Big Bend, inland Georgia and Alabama, eventually portions of the southeast Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤3%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions with occasional gusts 20–30 kt possible late week-end.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None anticipated along the southeast Georgia coast given current forecast track.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain with totals generally 1–2 inches; isolated higher amounts possible if the center tracks closer.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and rip-current risk late week-end into Monday.
